alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 10:18PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Piney River Near Vernon affecting Hickman County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Piney River Near Vernon. * WHEN...From this evening to midday tomorrow. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding begins to impact low lying areas along the river from Interstate 40 to near Pinewood, Nunnelly, and down to the Duck River. Area roads may be affected, including Plunders Creek Rd, Garner Creek Rd, Beaver Creek Rd, Pinewood Rd, Mill Creek Rd, and Pretty Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 13.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and remain high overnight before falling Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1200 PM CST.
